We need your help to continue protecting against the erosion of civil liberties in West Virginia.
  

Dear ##first_name[Supporter]##,

It's official – the 2018 legislative session is underway in West Virginia.

Whether working for or against particular legislation, we expect to have our hands full this year. We'll be pushing bills on issues related to bail reform, regulating civil asset forfeiture, net neutrality, establishing an independent redistricting commission and banning conversion therapy.

Additionally, we expect the introduction of bills attacking your constructional rights. These include efforts to eliminate Medicaid funding for abortion, unfairly targeting the transgender community with a bathroom bill and allowing businesses to openly discriminate against the LGBTQ community.

Now more than ever, we need your help to continue protecting against the erosion of civil liberties in West Virginia. Head over to our blog to learn more about some of the offensive and defensive measures we expect to face this session. If you haven't already, like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter to receive the most up-to-date information on ways you can make a difference.

The future is ours to claim – let's take a stand together.

Sincerely,

ACLU of West Virginia
